name: Acetaminophen (Tylenol)
description: Reduces fever and relieves minor aches and pains.
side_effects: Rarely causes side effects. Liver damage possible with overdose.

name: Ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin)
description: Reduces fever and relieves pain and inflammation.
side_effects: Stomach upset, heartburn, nausea. Increased risk of heart attack or stroke.

name: Phenylephrine
description: Decongestant that shrinks blood vessels in the nasal passages.

name: Guaifenesin (Mucinex)
description: Expectorant that helps loosen phlegm and thin bronchial secretions.

name: Dextromethorphan (Robitussin DM)
description: Cough suppressant that affects signals in the brain that trigger cough reflex.
dosage: Adults: 10-20mg every 4 hours or 30mg every 6-8 hours. Max 120mg/day.

name: Aspirin
side_effects: Stomach upset, heartburn. Risk of Reye's syndrome in children.

name: Loratadine (Claritin)
description: Antihistamine that treats allergy symptoms like sneezing, runny nose, watery eyes.

name: Calcium Carbonate (Tums)
description: Antacid that relieves heartburn, acid indigestion, and upset stomach.
dosage: Adults: 2-4 tablets as symptoms occur. Max 7500mg/day.

name: Loperamide (Imodium)
description: Slows down digestion to decrease the frequency of bowel movements.
dosage: Adults: 4mg initially, then 2mg after each loose stool. Max 8mg/day.

name: Melatonin
description: Hormone supplement that helps regulate sleep-wake cycles.
dosage: Adults: 0.5mg to 5mg taken 30-60 minutes before bedtime.

name: Diphenhydramine (Benadryl)
description: Antihistamine primarily used for allergies, but also causes drowsiness.
side_effects: Significant drowsiness, dizziness, dry mouth, blurred vision.
